sources.data_found: Spring 2025 Enrollment: 4,514 undergraduate students; 18,303 graduate students; 462 Ph.D. students within the College of Computing.
As of Spring 2025, the OMSCS (online) program has 16,609 enrolled students.
AI Makerspace Phase I: 20 NVIDIA HGX H100 systems (160 H100 GPUs). AI Makerspace Phase II (Fall 2024 rollout): 18 NVIDIA HGX H200 systems (144 H200 GPUs).
October 2025 maintenance update: Added 5 new H200 GPU nodes to the Phoenix research cluster (total 40 H200 GPUs).

student_data.notes: Updated to exclude online students. On-campus Master's count (1,232) is calculated by subtracting the OMSCS enrollment (16,609) and Ph.D. enrollment (462) from the total College of Computing graduate enrollment (18,303) as reported for Spring 2025. This ensures the count accurately reflects the residential student population sharing physical hardware resources.

gpu_resources.notes:
CALCULATIONS:
1) AI Makerspace (Residential Student Access): Phase I provided 160 H100 GPUs. Phase II (active as of early 2025) added 18 HGX nodes with 8x H200 each, totaling 144 H200 GPUs dedicated to student work.
2) Phoenix Cluster (Research): October 2025 expansion added 5 nodes with 8x H200 each (40 H200). A100 (24 80GB + 8 40GB) and V100 (80) counts remain consistent with latest PACE inventory reports.

Total H200 = 144 (Makerspace) + 40 (Phoenix) = 184.

analysis_notes: Enrollment data now isolates the residential student body (On-campus MS + PhD) to better reflect the GPUs-per-student ratio for on-site hardware like the AI Makerspace. GPU counts are updated to include the Phase II Makerspace H200 expansion and the late-2025 Phoenix research cluster upgrades.
